DataElement.preferredName: Postoperative Adverse Event Intubation Adult Respiratory Distress Syndrome Day Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a value counting days on which insertion of a tube into the trachea was required to treat respiratory failure after surgery occurring as unfavorable symptoms (time-)associated with medical procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Postoperative Adverse Event Intubation Adult Respiratory Distress Syndrome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the insertion of a tube into the trachea to treat respiratory failure occurring after surgery as unfavorable, unintended symptoms temporally associated with a medical product or procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: After surgery.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Property.preferredDefinition: Intubation; the insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.:fulminant pulmonary interstitial and alveolar edema resulting from diffuse infection, shock, or trauma of the lungs.

Concepts.definition: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.

Progressive and life-threatening pulmonary distress in the absence of an underlying pulmonary condition, usually following major trauma or surgery. Cases of neonatal respiratory distress syndrome are not included in this definition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number of days during which an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The period of time during which something continues.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: No change, trying to fix issue in CDE Browser where details page won't open for the associated CDE. - DW 8-17-2017

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
